thread.title: New York Taxi Drivers See State Fee as Blow to Battered Industry

author: Paul Berger
title: New York Taxi Drivers See State Fee as Blow to Battered Industry
text:
The state budget dealt a blow to New York’s struggling taxi and livery car industry, imposing a fee of $2.50 to $2.75 per trip in Manhattan’s business district to pay for improvements to mass transit.
While some public-transportation advocates complained the budget doesn’t charge all vehicles entering Manhattan’s busiest areas, taxi drivers said the fees could turn away passengers and further dent their already declining incomes.
